alert.note: Alert for Bell; Clay; Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 1:48PM EDT until August 07 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Bell, Clay and Knox. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 147 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Barbourville, Barnyard, Dewitt, Walker, Scalf, Hammond, Salt Gum, Hinkle, Baughman, Bimble, Yeager, Girdler, Cannon, Mills, Heidrick, Erose, Baileys Switch, Field, Lowell and Bentley Station. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
